column2: A remote building located in the mountains intended to provide board and lodging.
A furnished apartment or flat with cooking and bathroom facilities that can be rented for holiday vacations.
A facility with living aquatic animals for public viewing.
A public piece of art.
Object of interest for a tourist.
An tent or caravan pitch location within a campsite or caravan site
An area where people can camp overnight using tents, camper vans or caravans.
A place where you can stay in a caravan overnight or for longer periods.
A holiday cottage with self-contained cooking and bathroom facilities.
An area or building that displays a variety of visual art exhibitions.
Accommodation without hotel license that is typically owner-operated, such as bed&breakfasts etc.
Cheap accommodation with shared bedrooms.
Hotel - an establishment that provides paid lodging
Information for tourists and visitors, including information offices
Short term accommodation, particularly for people travelling by car.
A museum: an institution with exhibitions on scientific, historical, cultural topics
A locality that is suitable for outdoors eating, with facilities to aid a picnic such as tables and benches
An amusement park where entertainment is provided by rides, games, concessions.
A place worth visiting, often high, with a good view of surrounding countryside or notable buildings.
A remote building, with generally a fireplace, intended to provide temporary shelter and sleeping accommodation, typically un-serviced and with no staff
A zoological garden, where animals are confined.
